content.body: is it supposed to be correct that `m.foo = 5` assignment where `m` is a ModuleNamespace only throws in strict mode, not in sloppy mode?
content.formatted_body: is it supposed to be correct that m.foo = 5 assignment where m is a ModuleNamespace only throws in strict mode, not in sloppy mode?

content.body: just spent way too long debugging why in Node.js it was allowed when importing a namespace into a CJS module...
I believe that is expected, and has more to do with sloppy mode than it has to do with modules.
